ingredients: 1/4 tsp red chili powder (adjust to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or pan over medium heat.
Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chili (if using). Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a minute.
Add cauliflower, potatoes, and eggplant to the pot. Mix well with the spices.
Add about 1/2 cup of water, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in garam masala and chopped cilantro.
Serve hot with roti, paratha, or rice.
cooking_tips: You can add other vegetables like peas or green beans to this sabzi.
For a richer flavor, you can add a tablespoon of oil or ghee at the end.
If you want a drier sabzi, skip adding water and cook the vegetables in their own moisture.
Adjust the amount of spices according to your preference.
